name: Four Points by Sheraton Downtown Seattle Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first stop on our 15 day, 10 hotel drive down from Seattle through Northern California. The room was large, the bed was comfortable and as it turned out, the breakfast was the best of all the hotels as you could order just about anything off the menu. I'm not a fan of the bulk items, so getting french toast was great. The location was ideal.
reviews.title: Very good hotel but a bit pricey

reviews.text: Fantastic location, great value, friendly & accommodating staff, & very nicely-updated hotel! We stayed here the night before a cruise. Love the location - walked to a wonderful restaurant, Ten Mercer, grocery & drug store just down the street, 10-minute walk to Space Needle and monorail. Nicely-appointed rooms, lovely courtyard with water fountain that helped diffuse the city noise. Free bottled water in our rooms. Shuttle to Pier 91 was $7 pp. Highly recommend. There was a big band of kids staying there when we were - a bit noisy but that's not the hotel's fault. Try the breakfast pastries - out of this world!
reviews.title: Great Overnight Before Cruise

reviews.text: I was in town for business and stayed a total of three nights in this hotel. My first two day stay was excellent. Check in was quick, my room was clean and room service was quick and tasty. It is a couple of miles from what I would consider downtown with the market, lots of shopping and good food. Not many diner recommendations around the hotel. I checked out of the hotel to travel to another city and rechecked in. When I rechecked in I asked if they had transportation to downtown to the market, etc. They stated no and that they only had tranportation to the airport and that was their exact words. I don't know about you but the words, "we only have transportation to the airport" makes me believe it is supplied by the hotel. I showed up in the hotel lobby at 4:30 am and a town car was waiting for me. I quickly realized that the hotel didn't have transportation but they called me a towncar. I get in the car and realize the town car service doesn't take a credit card. I rarely carry cash but thankfully had $60 bucks on me. It think it was very misleading for the hotel to claim they have transporation to the airport. In most hotels I have stayed at for business they state they can call a cab or a town car and let me know the amount and if they take credit card ect. It ended fine because my company will reimburse me for this expense. But if I was there with my family and we were on a budget I would have been very unhappy.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay with one complaint

reviews.text: We spent six nights here this month and found the staff incredibly helpful! The hotel is fairly typical of downtown Seattle hotels but has a lovely bar and courtyard with outdoor fireplace. Room extra clean--housekeeping great and beds extra comfy.
reviews.title: Amazing staff!

reviews.text: The day manager was extremely helpful with a credit card issue (trying to get hotel points) and the night desk manager actually printed my kid's homework from his office computer! The breakfast staff are great and the food is very good as well.
reviews.title: One of the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was in conjunction with a cruise package which we purchased prior to sailing to Alaska. It was a great value, which included parking for the week we were away, breakfast the morning of our departure, and shuttle service to the pier. Upon our return, we stayed an additional three nights and were not disappointed. The customer service at the front desk is outstanding, particularly the service and help we received from Nikki. She answered our questions about the area, gave great tips on attractions, and arranged for us to even check in earlier than planned. The hotel is relatively new and well appointed. The room was large and very comfortable, with a great bed. Parking in Seattle is a nightmare and extremely expensive, but the hotel's parking rate was half that of their neighbors. Parking is very safe, in an underground secured parking garage. The hotel operates a "fireside cafe" downstairs with reasonable prices for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Room service is also available, as is a guest laundry. The only downside was no spa or pool, which would have been welcomed after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The location is very convenient, with a nice walk to the Space Needle and the monorail system.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great service and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was hesitant to stay at this hotel based on recent TripAdvisor reviews mentioning renovation and construction noise from across the street. However, upon staying here on a weekday, there was no renovation (it may be complete as of this posting?) and there was no construction going on across the street (though this could have been a one day anomaly).
reviews.title: One of the better Four Points

reviews.text: We received a room that faced the courtyard with no views beside overlooking the HVAC units. We didn't get too much street noise, but we could hear the light hum of traffic from the main street nearby. The room appeared clean and pretty nicely renovated. Parking was $12, which appears to be average for that area.
reviews.title: Bad bones

reviews.text: The hotel is located a few blocks from a 24 hour grocery store as well as some really nice restaurants. It is also close enough to walk to the Seattle Center to visit the museum and/or the Space Needle. Definitely would stay here again for the price.
reviews.title: Super hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good: The hotel is located in a quet area. Everything looks new. The bathroom is large and roomy. The bed is comfortable. The room is large and well appointed.
reviews.title: Great for the price point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days. The bed was huge and comfy! The room was quiet and clean. WiFi is free. Desk staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location to the Space Needle and the monorail. We walked downtown every morning, and took the monorail back every afternoon. Parking is connected to the hotel, which made it easy to come and go after hours. Cheap parking ($12 compared to $25 for downtown rates) is a plus! QFC is open 24 hours and is within a block from the hotel, so it was easy to grab breakfast and snacks. Citizen, a kick-butt coffeehouse, is also within a block away.
reviews.title: Convenient and

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel conveniently located next to the Convention Center, and is centrally located. The room I had was spacious and clean with wireless Wi-Fi. The bathroom was clean and had he usual amenities. The bed was very comfortable. An exercise room was available, and the concierge desk very helpful. Easy to walk to most places in downtown you might like to go. The "coffee shop" store is convenient to grab something for breakfast or lunch. Overall, a very nice and convenient place to stay for a meeting.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for one night on a business trip. The check in was very easy and the lady at the desk had all of my information ready. When i got up to my room it was right opposite the elavators so I called back downstairs to change my room. The lady at the desk was really helpful and took care of that without making me feel as is I'd committed a crime by asking to change rooms. I had the exact same spec room much further down the hall. Breakfast the next morning was quite, nice and friendly staff - I was the fisrt person in when they opened on the Saturday morning.
reviews.title: Easy in and easy out!

reviews.text: It was very close to a 24 hour grocey store, a few blocks from the Space Needle and a few blocks from a few really nice Asian restaurants.
reviews.title: It's okay

reviews.text: A very uneventful stay - which was a good thing.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Four Points

reviews.text: The location was great, my family walked to the space needle in 5 minutes. Lots of great restaurants and bars. I wish that there was a pool at the hotel, and a blender in the bar. The rooms were clean and pull outs nice, maid service is kinda so so, but we would stay again at the Hotel.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: After reading the reviews tripadvisor, I have put in a request of the room staying away from the construction area when I booked my room. However, when I checked in, I realized my room is right across from the construction area. The manager told me they would only try to accomodate the booking request. After driving for the whole day, I just want to rest well, however the room took me 30 mins wait and finally I got a room away from the construction area.
reviews.title: forget about the booking request

reviews.text: There's a plus for the server in the kitchen. I have bought in some microwavable campbell soup but since there's no microwave in room, I can't reheat it myself. The server helped me to microwave it and gave me some biscuits to eat w my soup.
reviews.title: Amazing showers and good view

reviews.text: Overall, I don't think I would stay in this hotel again as the rate isn't low ($121+ taxes) but I have to keep on calling to get the room that I have requested in 2 weeks ago. There's no toothbrush, and toothpaste in room that I have to call the operator to bring to me.
reviews.title: Keep an eye on your possessions, cleaning staff steals !

reviews.text: My main memory was that it has the best shower head I've probably ever experienced. Also there was a view of the Space Needle from the balcony of our room. It's a fairly short walk to the Pacific Science Centre and even shorter to the bus stop that we used to go watch a Seattle Seahawks game. From memory the beds were good too but they have probably been changed by now. The breakfast was yummy. A great value hotel.
reviews.title: Great Stay

aka: 4 Points By Sheraton Downtown Seattle Center
description: Where the Action Is. The recently-renovated Four Points by Sheraton Downtown Seattle Center is close to all the city’s hotspots. You can walk to the Space Needle, Pike Place Market, and great restaurant and shopping districts. We also make it easy to drive around, with garage parking and nearby highways.Everything You Need. Our business center has free High Speed Internet Access so you can stay busy, and the workout room is open 24 hours a day. Enjoy a great meal by our cozy fireplace or a tasty drink at the bar. And we have a 529-square-foot event room, a boardroom, and a courtyard for any meeting or event you have in mind.Space Needle Views. Choose from our 158 guest rooms and suites, featuring a king or double Four Points by Sheraton Four Comfort Beds™. You’ll get plenty of free extras, like Showtime on a 42” Flat Screen Television and in-room coffee and tea.
